intro: Calyptranthes impressa, commonly known as the broadleaf calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are often marked with distinctive white or pale veins. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Calyptranthes impressa is typically evergreen and thrives in shaded, moist environments with well-drained soil.
